## Quarto

Quarto enables you to weave together content and executable code into a finished document. To learn more about Quarto see <https://quarto.org>.

## Running Code

When you click the **Render** button a document will be generated that includes both content and the output of embedded code. You can embed code like this:

```{r}
source("segment7.R")
```

```{=html}
`r segment7(0)`
```
1
```{=html}
`r segment7(1)`
```
2
You can add options to executable code like this 
```{=html}
`r segment7(2)`
```
3

```{=html}
`r segment7(3)`
```
4

```{=html}
`r segment7(4)`
```

5

```{=html}
`r segment7(5)`
```

6

```{=html}
`r segment7(6)`
```

7

```{=html}
`r segment7(7)`
```

8

```{=html}
`r segment7(8)`
```

9

```{=html}
`r segment7(9, height= 100)`
```
asdf

```{=html}
`r segment7(9); segment7(8)`
```


```{r}
svg0 <- segment7(0)
svg1 <- segment7(1)

svg0 <- paste0(segment7(0)

test <- "1010101"

```

```{r}
print_svgs <- function(test){
  for(i in strsplit(test, "")[[1]]){
    svg_to_add <- ifelse(i == "0", svg0, svg1)
    cat('<div style="display: inline-block; width: 20%; height: auto;">', svg_to_add, '</div>\n')
  }
}
```

```{=html}
`r print_svgs(test)`
```
